channel.title: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!
channel.description: Ok so I run the server I get on it with my computer right cause im hosting it myself but on my other computer I type in server ip and I tried 127.0.0.1...nothing worked if someone has a answer or say I just cant do it that would be great ;D Thank you to anyone who can slove me problem :)

item.title: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!

item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

after setting up utorrent to your port(43594) reset it to the random port and close it by right click and click close in the system tray that is the rest to what cows said

item.source: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!

item.title: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!
item.dc:creator: @cows1471 cows1471
item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

razami:

What if im using u torrent to portfoward???

No problems there then.

I wrote a tutorial here:

Hello and welcome to the first of my tutorials. What i am going to show you is very easy to do, but can save a hell of a lot of time fiddling around with portforwarding.

Why? Some people recently in the MoparScape help section have been posting portforwarding problems.
Diffuculty:
0.001 / 10 for experienced
possibly 1/10 for less experienced.

Objective: Portforwarding without going through your router.

Step 1: Downloading µTorrent

[size=14pt]http://www.utorrent.com/download.php[/size]

I think downloading is the easiest bit. Simply download and install.

Now run the programme.

  1. Popped up?

So you have run the programme for the first time and this pops up

[size=16pt]Ignore the red ring!!! Press cancel.[/size]

Now we need to portforward.

  1. Portforwarding

Your utorrent client should look like this:

If it does then great
[size=11pt]If it has minimised, it is probably in the system tray thing. Look to the bottom right of your screen and look for the tiny green and white µ icon[/size]

Now we have it up go into options -> preferences:

It should look something like this:

Now we need to change these options.
[size=13pt]I will change the port to match port 43594 but change it to your own port[/size]

[size=15pt]MAKE SURE THE TICKS ARE JUST LIKE THE ONES IN THIS PICTURE!!![/size]

Press ok and then minimise it!

Now its time to check if it has worked!!!

Go to this website: [size=14pt]again set up for port 43594[/size]

[size=11pt]http://www.utorrent.com/testport?port=43594[/size]

If it looks like this:

You have sucessfully portforwarded correctly.

If not please go over this tutorial again.

If you have any problems / comments for this tutorial, don’t hesitate to post!

-bill

Read full topic

item.title: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!
item.dc:creator: @cows1471 cows1471
item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

[quote=“razami, post:1, topic:322821”]Ok so I run the server I get on it with my computer right cause im hosting it myself
but on my other computer I type in server ip and I tried 127.0.0.1…nothing worked if someone has a answer or say I just cant do it that would be great ;D
Thank you to anyone who can slove me problem :)[/quote]

Thats because the two computers are like positively charged ions.

They will repel because there are no negatives to attract them.

You need no-ip, a port-forwarded router and common sence.

Set up no-ip to your address e.t.c.

Type in ipconfig in command prompt.

More info on starting a server - sticky in tuts

Portforward.com to portforward

thats it

Read full topic

item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

@wwe4eva, yes it will i got what haxifix said to work not in the way he said it but i got it to work so stfu.
Razami use no-ip to host because it is free and a vps costs money to keep up a month and no-ip is free all you have to do is just keep your pc on with the monitor off.

item.title: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!
item.dc:creator: @wwe4eva wwe4eva
item.description:
@wwe4eva wrote:

Don’t listen to haxifix, that won’t work.

What you are trying to do is not possible, because it’s on the same ISP, regardless of your IP address.

Either play on the computer that is hosting or buy a VPS/Dedi.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!

item.title: Please help how do i get on my server with the same ip?!
item.dc:creator: @haxifix haxifix
item.description:
@haxifix wrote:

If you have a router you need to portfoward port 43594 or whatever port you are on, and then goto no-ip.com and register a account, then make a new host, name it what you want it to be, then download thei DUC Client and make sure your host is updated, then when you want to play you type in the host name that you registered and there you go.

There are tutorials on how to do it on MoparScape and Google, please search before posting.

Read full topic
